{"step_by_step_thinking": "P-glycoprotein is a protein that pumps foreign substances out of cells. It is important in drug interactions because it can affect the absorption, distribution, and elimination of various drugs. Azithromycin, Ketoconazole, and Itraconazole are all antibiotics or antifungal medications, and they are not known to induce P-glycoprotein. On the other hand, Rifampicin is a well-known inducer of P-glycoprotein.", "answer_choice": "D. Rifampicin"}
